messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] help w/ h/s laws
messages.msgSnippet: BlankHi Julie, You can probably find what you need through these links: HELM has millions of links!
messages.messageBody:
Blank
Hi Julie,
 
You can probably find what you need through these links:
 
HELM has millions of links! http://www.helmonline.com/pages/res/elists/elistsindex.shtml
The following are from Home Education Magazine.
Here are some support groups: http://www.home-ed-magazine.com/wlcm_groups.html
Here are National Groups and organizations: http://www.home-ed-magazine.com/groups/orgs.html
 
Kim

writes:

<< an someone send me the website for homeschool state laws?

Hi Julie --

There are several but one to try is: www.nhen.org -- click on Legal Info, I
think it is.

Nance

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] help w/ h/s laws
messages.msgSnippet: If you use H$LDA s, besure to double check as the last time they were checked there were errors in several states (our s was one ).  I would cross check
messages.messageBody:
If you use H$LDA's, besure to double check as the last time they were
checked there were errors in several states (our's was one <g>). I would
cross check with NHEN.

Lynda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] help w/ h/s laws
messages.msgSnippet: ... I wouldn t trust what I find on this site.  The last time we checked 14 states were wrong, incomplete or had interpretation problems.  Remember these guys
messages.messageBody:
>
>http://www.hslda.org
>


I wouldn't trust what I find on this site. The last time we checked 14
states were wrong, incomplete or had interpretation problems. Remember
these guys make a living off of your belief that the laws are scary and hard
to live with.

LisaKK

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] help w/ h/s laws
messages.msgSnippet: HEN and Unschooling.com both have the state laws on site, as does NHEN.  And well... since I updated them not too long ago, maybe I can answer your question?
messages.messageBody:
HEN and Unschooling.com both have the state laws on site, as does NHEN. And
well... since I updated them not too long ago, maybe I can answer your
question?
